description: Removal of condition 13 (Level 4 of the code for sustainable homes) of planning permission PP/2013/5620 dated 15/07/2014 for Erection of part single, part two and part three storey extension, erection of third floor to existing blocks of flats to provide 8 additional Nursing Home bedrooms (Use Class C2), 7 Extra Care Units (5 x 1-bed and 2 x studio) (Use Class C2) and two self-contained flats (1 x 2-bed and 1 x 1-bed) (Use Class C3), together with associated parking and soft landscaping.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 15/07/2014, the date of planning permission PP/2013/2020.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) (11535/1/10, 11535/1/17A, 11535/1/18A, 11535/2/11B, 11535/2/12B, 11535/2/13B, 11535/2/14, 11535/2/15A, 11535/2/16, 11535/2/19, 11535/2/20A, & 11535/2/21) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be implemented in accordance with PP/2015/6458 issued on Friday 22 April 2016, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the host buildings and surroundings in accordance with policies 7.4, 7b and 7c of the Ealing Development Management DPD, and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2015).

| Hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out in accordance with reference: PP/2015/6459 issued on 22/04/2016 prior to the occupation of any part of the development. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD, policies 1.1 (i) of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015).

| Car parking shall be carried out in accordance with PP/2015/3788 approved on the 29/09/2015. The car parking space shall be made available prior to first occupation of any part of the development; this parking area shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking and access within the site, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2015).
| External lighting of the development shall be carried out in accordance with details approved via PP/2015/3791 issued on 29/09/2015 and completed prior to occupation.

Reason: To protect the working and living conditions of occupiers in the locality in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1 j, of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The 8 no. additional bedrooms and 7 no. Extra Care Units shall only be used in conjunction with the use of the premises as a Residential Care Home for the elderly, (C2 - Residential Care Home) as described in the application and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class C2 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).

Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and to safeguard the amenities of the area, in accordance with policies L.V.7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2015 and policies 1.1 (g)(h) and (j) and 1.2(d) and (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012).

| The rating noise level emitted from any new external plant and machinery installed at the site, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of residents and neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1 j, of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Insulation and ventilation of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the details approved via PP/2015/3792 issued on 29/09/2015. The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1 j, of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Trees to be retained within the application site shall be protected during all construction work in accordance with British Standard 5837:2005 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations' (or any subsequent revision). The protective fencing and other protection measures specified in this recommendation and guidance shall be maintained fully intact at all times, until the completion of all building operations on the site (unless agreed otherwise in writing by the Local Planning Authority). No activity of any description must occur at any time underneath the canopy-spread areas including but not restricted to the following:
a) No mixing of cement or any other materials.
b) Storage or disposal of any soil, building materials, rubble, machinery, fuel, chemicals, liquids waste residues or materials/debris of any other description.

c) Siting of any temporary structures of any description including site office/sales buildings, temporary car parking facilities, porta-loos, storage compounds or hard standing areas of any other description.
d) Soil/turf stripping, lowering of existing ground levels, excavation or alterations to the existing surfaces/ ground conditions of any other description.
e) Installation/siting of any underground services, temporary or otherwise including; drainage, water, gas, electricity, telephone, television, external lighting or any associated ducting.
In addition to the protection measures specified above:
a)	No fires shall be lit within 20 metres of the trunks of any trees or the centre line of any hedgerow shown to be retained.
b) No signs, cables, fixtures or fittings of any other description shall be attached to any part of any retained tree.

Reason: To safeguard the trees in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and setting of the development in accordance with section 11 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7B and 7.4 of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); policies 7.4, 7.5, 7.6 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015), and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 Trees and Development Guidelines'

| Erection of part single part two and part three storey extension, erection of third floor to existing blocks of flats to provide 8 additional Nursing Home bedrooms (Use Class C2), 7 Extra Care Units (5 x 1-bed and 2x studio) (Use Class 2) and two self-contained flats (1x 2-bed and 1x 1 bed) (Use Class 3) together with associated parking and soft landscaping, hereby approved, shall be constructed to Lifetime-Homes standards and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy 7.2 of the London Plan (2015).
